text:
I hope everyone had a great weekend üòä. Here are a few updates, what we‚Äôre learning this week, and reminders:
Scholastic Book Fair is Monday, October 21st- Friday, October 25th. Students will be going to the bookfair during their STEAM specials. Our class has STEAM on Friday. Cash will not be accepted. You will need to set up an e-wallet for your child. Here is the link: https://bookfairs.scholastic.com/bf/hillsboroacadbobcats
We are looking for volunteers for the book fair. Sign-up here: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10C0F4BADAA2DA5FBC34-52413759-scholastic#/
Trunk or Treat is this Friday, October 25th from 6-8 p.m.
Check PowerSchool Weekly.
Upcoming: Conference week will take place the week of November 18th. I will be sending a signup genius in a separate email.
Reading/ELA: We will be wrapping up Unit 1 this week. Students will take their Unit 1 Assessment on Wednesday.
Unit 1: How do different places affect us?
This week in Reading: Realistic Fiction, Informational Text, Poetry
Students will read various texts that are realistic fiction, informational text, and poetry.
Realistic Fiction: A story that is made up but can happen in real life. A realistic fiction story will have characters, setting, and a plot (beginning, middle, end).
Informational Text: Gives us information. Informational text will have labels, diagrams, picture, bold words, and captions.
Poetry: Tells a story, appeals to feelings and senses, using descriptive words. Poetry will have rhyme, rhythm, lines, and stanzas.
This week in ELA: Simple Sentences & Long Vowels
High Frequency Words:
Also
Large
Small
Spelling Words:
Cart
Mark
Garden
Forest
Roar
Core
Tore
Chore
Fort
Board
Spelling and r-Controlled Vowels:
Students will work on editing sentences for spelling and writing r-controlled vowel words (-ar, -or,-ore, -oar). They will also work on using resources to spell words. I would highly suggest practicing this at home with your student.
Spelling Words Quiz
No spelling words quiz this week or next week.
Review
Please review simple sentences, and subject & predicate with your child this week.

Read for 20mins. every night üìö (no reading log)
Use MyOn via Clever for access to books!

Separate the "boxes/ sections" 1 to 2 per night.

Complete recommended lessons

Homework is due every Friday.
